name: Quinoa Upma Recipe
description: Quinoa Upma Recipe. Indian Savory Breakfast or Side with Quinoa with mustard seeds, toasted cashews, carrots and peas. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp organic canola or safflower oil
1/2 tsp urad dal (split black gram or use mung dal (petite yellow lentils))
1  green chili chopped (remove seeds to adjust spice if needed)
a generous pinch of asafeotida hing (optional (omit to make gluten-free or use certified gf asafetida))
cilantro and lemon juice for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the quinoa several times, drain and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash the quinoa several times, drain and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium skillet, add oil and heat at medium. When the oil is hot, add mustard seeds and urad dal and let them sputter or sizzle for 15 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium skillet, add oil and heat at medium. When the oil is hot, add mustard seeds and urad dal and let them sputter or sizzle for 15 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chili, asafeotida and curry leaves and cook for half a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chili, asafeotida and curry leaves and cook for half a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onions and cashews and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onions and cashews and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ginger, carrots, and cook for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ginger, carrots, and cook for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add quinoa and roast for 2 minutes with the veggies.
recipeInstructions.name: Add quinoa and roast for 2 minutes with the veggies.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt, water, peas, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low-medium, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Let the quinoa sit covered for 5 minutes. then uncover, fluff and serve. Garnish with cilantro and generous lemon juice. Serve as a side, or as breakfast with hot masala chai.
